business.headline: Nithin Kamath says STT hike won't curb F&O trade. Here's whyIn the Union Budget 2026, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced an increase in STT on futures and options trades.

Cigarettes to cost more now: Check the latest pricesSmokers are now paying more at the counter. From February 1, cigarette prices have gone up following a fresh tax hike, marking the first increase in nearly seven years.

Gold, silver prices continue to fall. Should you buy now?Gold and silver prices have tumbled sharply over the past few days. Read on to know the reason behind the rapid decline, and whether investors should buy or wait for further correction.

Why the government raised STT, making F&O trading more expensiveFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman made it clear in her Budget speech that the Securities Transaction Tax, or STT, will go up for derivatives trades from April 1, 2026.

Why LTCG tax is back in the spotlight after Budget 2026After Budget 2026, long-term capital gains have emerged as a key talking point among investors and market watchers alike. So why is LTCG suddenly being discussed everywhere?

Gold, silver extend losses today: Check latest MCX rates and city-wise pricesIn India, the correction in global prices has filtered into domestic bullion markets as well. Gold was priced at Rs 143,460 per 10 grams, down by Rs 4,780 or 3.22% as of 9:55 am.
Sensex, Nifty open flat but surge ahead a few minutes into early tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 161.62 points to 80,884.56, while the NSE Nifty50 added 9.80 points to 24,835.25 as of 9:28 am.

Sensex, Nifty today: Will stock market crash again?Gift Nifty futures (GIFc1) were trading at 24,869.5 points at around 8:00 am. This suggests that the benchmark Nifty 50 index may open close to Sunday's closing level of 24,825.45.

Budget 2026: Will your Sovereign Gold Bond gains face higher tax?The tax benefit still exists, but it is now available only in a specific situation. Earlier, individual investors did not have to pay any capital gains tax if they held a Sovereign Gold Bond till maturity, but after the Budget 2026 announcement that has changed.

Big vision, tight margins: Why execution will make or break this BudgetThe direction for Budget 2026 is right, but delivery will decide credibility. In that sense, this is a Budget that excites on paper while simultaneously inviting scrutiny on execution.
Parliament gets Rs 1,492 crore in Budget 2026Parliament has been allocated Rs 1,492 crore in the Union Budget 2026 presented by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman today.

Macro stability is not to be sniffed at: Sanjeev Sanyal calls Budget 2026 solid, no-nonsenseEconomist and PM's Economic Advisory Council member Sanjeev Sanyal has described the Union Budget 2026 as a "solid, no-nonsense" exercise, arguing that fiscal consolidation and macro stability are its core strengths. He rejected the notion that the absence of "big-bang" announcements made the budget underwhelming.

Govt raises duty-free goods import limit to Rs 75,000 under new baggage rulesA tourist of foreign origin, not being an infant, arriving in India, shall be allowed duty-free clearance of articles up to the value of Rs 25,000. This limit was Rs 15,000 under the Baggage Rules, 2016.

MGNREGA cut, VB-G RAM G gets a boost: Union Budget 2026 signals a rural resetUnder the Budget, VB-G RAM G has been allocated Rs 95,692 crore, positioning it as the single largest component of the Department of Rural Development's spending.

Ashwini Vaishnaw outlines India's high-speed rail future, semiconductor mission 2.0Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw outlined initiatives for developing around 4,000 km high-speed network in India and the next phase of the India Semiconductor Mission, focusing on self-reliance and infrastructure growth.

Budget 2026 ignored 10 key challenges flagged in Economic Survey: ChidambaramFormer Finance Minister P Chidambaram criticised the Union Budget 2026-27 for not addressing core economic challenges flagged in the recent Economic Survey, raising questions on fiscal management and policy priorities.

Hollow, disappointing: Bhupinder Hooda says Budget 2026 left Haryana empty-handedFormer Haryana CM Bhupinder Singh Hooda termed the Union Budget 2025–26 "hollow and disappointing," alleging it discriminated against Haryana and offered no relief to the common man.

Budget: India AI mission gets big push. AI to boost governance, says SitharamanPresenting the Union Budget 2026–27, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman highlighted the transformative role of artificial intelligence and other emerging technologies. Calling AI a "force multiplier for better governance," she outlined plans for a full-stack, ethical and inclusive AI ecosystem.

Has Budget 2026 silently focused on poll-bound Tamil Nadu and West Bengal?While Tamil Nadu walked away with a Rare Earths Corridor, high-speed rails, cash crop boosts and a push for its key archaeological site, West Bengal too gained in the Union Budget 2026-27 through a freight corridor and high-speed rail line. Both the non-BJP states will be holding Assembly polls in 2026.

The Budget and this analysis. None will change your lifeOnce upon a time, the Union Budget had significance in the everyday life of Indians. Not any more. Yet, out of sheer stubborn habit, we spot the brass band and start swaying senselessly every Budget day.

entertainment.headline: Dhurandhar viral scene: Aditya Dhar explains detailing after fans praise his vision Amid a viral scene from 'Dhurandhar', director Aditya Dhar explained the minute detailing behind it, revealing how even the smallest visual choices were carefully designed to define the characters and elevate the realism of the moment.

Bridgerton 4 Part 1 ending explained: Sophie, Benedict, and the problem with 'more' At the end of Bridgerton Season 4 Part I, Benedict's confession to Sophie promises "more" but delivers a devastating truth about love and class. Here's why his offer forces Sophie to walk away, and what it sets up next.

On this day in 1989, Satyajit Ray received France's highest civilian honour Satyajit Ray was conferred with France's highest civilian award, the Legion of Honour, on February 2, 1989. The then French President Francois Mitterrand arrived in Kolkata to present the filmmaker with this prestigious French national order of merit.

As If It's Your Last becomes BLACKPINK's 4th video to reach 1.5 billion views BLACKPINK's music video for As If It's Your Last surpassed 1.5 billion YouTube views on February 2, becoming their fourth official video to achieve this feat and reflecting the group's enduring global impact.

The 50 Day 1 highlights: Himesh Reshamiya's musical task, first eviction and more The first episode of the reality show The 50 featured 50 celebrities stepping into the Lion's Palace. The episode featured a music-based task, notable clashes, and the season's earliest elimination.

Justin Bieber's shirtless Grammy look sparks mixed reactions online: Risky choice Justin Bieber made a striking return to the Grammy stage in 2026 with a high-energy performance of Yukon and a daring fashion choice that set social media buzzing.

The 50 first impression: Forget Bigg Boss and Squid Game, this is reality chaos 'The 50' on Colors and Jio Hotstar is a high-octane reality show that blends survival drama with celebrity chaos. Fifty contestants, including TV stars and digital influencers, compete in an isolated palace and are not bound by any rules. Read what happens next.

Singeetam Srinivasa Rao at 94 announces new film after 10-year hiatus. Watch Veteran filmmaker Singeetam Srinivasa Rao is set to direct a new film, tentatively titled SSR61, with production by Nag Ashwin and Vyjayanthi Movies.

Ishq Ka Fever: Shahid Kapoor-Triptii Dimri share chemistry in O'Romeo's new song The romantic song Ishq Ka Fever from O'Romeo shows intense chemistry between Shahid Kapoor and Triptii Dimri's characters. The film is set for a theatrical release on February 13, 2026.

Rainman of Dhurandhar set: Check out why R Madhavan got this name R Madhavan shared a behind-the-scenes video from the sets of the opening sequence of Aditya Dhar's Dhurandhar. He discussed how unexpected weather shaped the shoot, as fans await the release of Dhurandhar 2.

Unreleased Tamil film Sandakari wins 3 State awards, fans question selection Unreleased Tamil film Sandakari won three Tamil Nadu State Film Awards, causing surprise. Fans question how an unreleased remake secured multiple honours amid original films.

Alia Bhatt's letter to her younger self: That dreamer in you is your superpower Alia Bhatt shared an emotional letter to her younger self, reflecting on dreams, love, family and self-belief in a heartfelt video.

From Billie Eilish to Bad Bunny, stars turn Grammys into anti-ICE protest platform The 2026 Grammy Awards in Los Angeles saw artists including Bad Bunny, Kehlani, Billie Eilish, and Olivia Dean use their platform to criticise US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), with visible protests on the red carpet and during acceptance speeches.

Shefali Bagga on AI image linking her to Yuzvendra Chahal: This is disgusting Bigg Boss 13 contestant Shefali Bagga responded to a meme going viral on Indian cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal's personal life. She criticised online trolls and the circulation of the AI-generated image that showed her alongside Dhanashree Verma and RJ Mahvash.

Arun Govil says no comparison between Nitesh Tiwari's Ramayana and Adipurush Arun Govil, famous for playing Lord Ram in the 1987 TV show Ramayan, discusses the comparisons between the upcoming Ramayana film and past adaptations, highlighting the importance of appearance in portraying divine roles and differentiating the new project from previous films.

Shekhar Kapur praises Dhurandhar's storytelling and performances Filmmaker Shekhar Kapur has praised Dhurandhar for its storytelling and performances. He congratulated producer Jyoti Deshpande and said that he was "looking forward to #Dhurandhar2."

Anurag Kashyap flags lack of political films in India, cites Hitler, Germany At the 17th Bengaluru International Film Festival, filmmaker Anurag Kashyap shared his views on the challenges of making political films in the current Indian climate. He talked about the importance of drawing inspiration from global cinema.

Grammys 2026: Billie Eilish, Kendrick Lamar and Bad Bunny score big Bad Bunny, Billie Eilish and Kendrick Lamar were awarded Album, Song and Record of the Year respectively at the recent Grammy Awards, reflecting the event's focus on recognising global sounds and boundary-breaking artistry.

Anoushka Shankar skips Grammy Awards 2026 for mental health, focusses on India tour Anoushka Shankar, nominated for two Grammy Awards in 2026 for her work on Chapter III: We Return to Light and Daybreak, opted not to attend the ceremony, highlighting challenges of anxiety and financial pressures associated with major award events.

general news.headline: Rahul Gandhi quotes ex-Army chief's memoir, Rajnath Singh objects, then fiery clashTensions flared in the Lok Sabha as Rahul Gandhi was interrupted by Rajnath Singh and Amit Shah for citing an unpublished book by former Army Chief General Manoj Naravane.

Baloch militant group releases photos of two suicide attackers. Both are womenThe Balochistan Liberation Army (BLA), which has claimed responsibility for the recent deadly and large-scale attack in Pakistan province, has released photos of two of their 'fidayee' (suicide) attackers and both are women.

Water instead of fuel in China's nuclear missiles led to Xi's military purge?The fall of Zhang Youxi, China's top uniformed military officer, in President Xi Jinping's purge might have to do with corruption, espionage and the PLA's operational readiness. Chinese missiles were found to have been filled with water instead of fuel, which led to the removal of the PLA Rocket Force's leadership in 2023 and 2024. Zhang is said to have passed on China's nuclear secrets to the US, and could be linked to the Rocket Force purge.

Porsche crash: Supreme Court grants bail to 3 accused of swapping blood samplesThe Supreme Court has granted bail to three accused of swapping blood samples in the 2024 Pune Porsche crash that killed two techies, Aneesh Awadhiya and Ashwini Koshta.

I'm on wife hunt, Epstein emailed Norway Crown Princess. Her responseThe shocking email exchanges, revealed in the latest batch of files, between sex offender Jeffrey Epstein and Norway Crown Princess Mette-Marit show the friendship between the two.

ICC may call board meet on Pakistan boycott threat, severe sanctions likelyThe ICC is set to meet soon to discuss Pakistan's threat to boycott the T20 World Cup match against India. On Sunday, the global body warned Pakistan of the possible implications and urged the Pakistan Cricket Board to take a decision in the best interests of global cricket.
SAD leader Bikram Singh Majithia gets bail in disproportionate assets caseThe Supreme Court granted bail to SAD leader Bikram Singh Majithia in Rs 700-crore disproportionate assets case.

Indian govt is cheap, hasn't been good ally to US: Nikki Haley's son at it againNalin Haley, son of Indian-origin diplomat and Republican leader Nikki Haley, has mounted a fresh attack against India. After a video of Ohio gubernatorial candidate Vivek Ramaswamy speaking of the need for the US to prioritise India over China resurfaced, Nalin argued that India was run by a cheap government profiting off cheap labour exports to the US.

Bridgerton 4 Part 1 ending explained: Sophie, Benedict, and the problem with 'more'At the end of Bridgerton Season 4 Part I, Benedict's confession to Sophie promises "more" but delivers a devastating truth about love and class. Here's why his offer forces Sophie to walk away, and what it sets up next.

Budget 2026: Will your Sovereign Gold Bond gains face higher tax?The tax benefit still exists, but it is now available only in a specific situation. Earlier, individual investors did not have to pay any capital gains tax if they held a Sovereign Gold Bond till maturity, but after the Budget 2026 announcement that has changed.

Delhi Police torturing Bengalis: Mamata Banerjee ahead of meet with poll chiefAhead of her meeting with Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar, Mamata Banerjee visited Banga Bhawan in Delhi, alleging that people from Bengal were being intimidated by Delhi Police.

Why the government raised STT, making F&O trading more expensiveFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman made it clear in her Budget speech that the Securities Transaction Tax, or STT, will go up for derivatives trades from April 1, 2026.

Grammys 2026: Chappell Roan goes topless, pushes fashion limits on red carpetSinger Chappell Roan turned heads on the Grammys red carpet with a revealing burgundy Mugler dress, as she celebrates two major nominations and reflects on her journey in the music industry.

Shame: Zohran Mamdani heckled after mother Mira Nair's name in Epstein FilesZohran Mamdani was heckled by protestors outside the New York mayor's residence following revelations linking his mother Mira Nair to Jeffrey Epstein. The incident follows the release of millions of pages of Epstein-related documents by the US Justice Department.

UP woman kills husband 2 months after marriage, stages suicide with parents' helpThree members of a family were arrested after investigations revealed that a man, initially believed to have died by suicide in Bareilly, was strangled by his wife over a gambling dispute, and the murder was allegedly staged as a suicide with the help of her family.

Boycott India match, but what about the final? Ex-cricketers question Pak stancePakistan's decision to boycott the India match has opened a bigger question. If the teams meet again later in the tournament, will Pakistan walk away from a World Cup final too?

Meet TK Radha: Indian scientist who stunned the father of the atom bombTK Radha was a brilliant Indian physicist who earned a rare invitation from Robert Oppenheimer to conduct research at Princeton. She had an incredible journey from a Kerala village to the global stage of theoretical physics.

Why the big-bang India-EU FTA has rattled both Pakistan and BangladeshExporters in both Pakistan and Bangladesh have warned that the India-EU Free Trade Agreement (FTA) could erode their hard-won advantages in the lucrative European market as Indian goods gain duty-free access. Hinting at India's Operation Sindoor, an official of a Pakistani traders' association said that Delhi had "opened an economic front" against Islamabad.

Give housing to Pak-born Dalit Hindus: Supreme Court halts eviction drive in DelhiThe Supreme Court stayed evictions for around 250 Pakistan-born Dalit Hindu families in Majnu Ka Tila and stressed that citizenship alone isn't enough without dignified housing. The court has also directed the government to submit its response in four weeks.

Don't believe Moltbook posts, many are by AI bots following instructions from humansIn the past couple of days, fear of AI doom and gloom seems to be taking over social media due to Moltbook – a website made for AI agents to discuss ideas with each other, without human involvement. But now reports surface that many of the controversial posts are actually made by humans through their bots.

Benjamin Button of the baseline: Djokovic, at 38, is still the great disruptorAt 38, Novak Djokovic fell short of a 25th major but shook tennis' new order. His Australian Open run showed Carlos Alcaraz and Jannik Sinner's duopoly is strong, not settled, and still vulnerable to the sport's greatest survivor ever produced.

Andrew sent photos of daughters to sex offender Epstein, emails show in big exposeAndrew sent photographs of his daughters, Princesses Eugenie and Beatrice, to Jeffrey Epstein, two years after claiming he had cut all contact following the sex offender's 2008 conviction for procuring a minor for prostitution.

Gavaskar trolls Pakistan's India boycott: Like their cricketers, a U-turn awaitsSunil Gavaskar took a swipe at Pakistan's India boycott call at the T20 World Cup, saying mounting pressure could force a U-turn, just as their cricketers have often reversed retirement decisions.

Taiwanese chipmaker Foxconn faces tax row in Karnataka, locals warn of protestFoxconn Hon Hai Technology India faces serious allegations from Bengaluru Rural Gram Panchayat over tax evasion, building regulation breaches and neglecting local employment in Karnataka villages.

sports.headline: ICC announces T20 World Cup warm-up match fixtures, livestreaming details T20 World Cup 2026: A total of 16 warm-up matches will be played between February 2 and 6 across four venues in India and Sri Lanka. While Suryakumar Yadav-led India will take on South Africa on February 4, India A, led by Ayush Badoni, will play two warm-up matches.

T20 World Cup: Fit-again Tilak Varma included in India A squad for warm-ups Tilak Varma returns to action as India include him in the India A warm-ups, marking his final fitness test before the T20 World Cup. The two matches will decide how soon he rejoins the senior side.

Carlos Alcaraz plans kangaroo tattoo to celebrate his Australian Open title win Fresh off a career-defining triumph, Carlos Alcaraz is considering a permanent reminder of his Australian Open glory in the form of a small kangaroo tattoo.

No win, no learn: Pak's selective boycott is a masterclass in hypocrisy T20 World Cup 2026: Pakistan's selective boycott of the India match isn't principle but panic. It is a tantrum that mocks history, hurts its cricket, and leaves Islamabad howling alone while the world plays on.

Batting great backs Pak's India boycott, alleges selective influence in ICC Pakistan's boycott of the India clash has sparked fresh debate across world cricket. Backed by Mohammad Yousaf, the move is being pitched as a stand against selective influence, not just a one-off protest.

ICC may call board meet on Pakistan boycott threat, severe sanctions likely The ICC is set to meet soon to discuss Pakistan's threat to boycott the T20 World Cup match against India. On Sunday, the global body warned Pakistan of the possible implications and urged the Pakistan Cricket Board to take a decision in the best interests of global cricket.

Boycott India match, but what about the final? Ex-cricketers question Pak stance Pakistan's decision to boycott the India match has opened a bigger question. If the teams meet again later in the tournament, will Pakistan walk away from a World Cup final too?

Delhi Capitals edge past UP Warriorz to book WPL 2026 Eliminator spot, MI bow out Delhi Capitals survived a late wobble to beat UP Warriorz and seal a WPL Eliminator berth. The five-wicket win also knocked defending champions Mumbai Indians out of the playoff race.

Football hasn't left Man United's Casemiro: Carragher makes U-turn after Fulham show Casemiro rolled back the years to run the show against Fulham. Jamie Carragher, once his harshest critic, admitted he was wrong as Manchester United's midfield general delivered a vintage, match-winning performance.

Benjamin Button of the baseline: Djokovic, at 38, is still the great disruptor At 38, Novak Djokovic fell short of a 25th major but shook tennis' new order. His Australian Open run showed Carlos Alcaraz and Jannik Sinner's duopoly is strong, not settled, and still vulnerable to the sport's greatest survivor ever produced.

IND vs PAK fiasco won't end here: Former Pakistan skipper on T20 World Cup boycott row Rashid Latif has warned that Pakistan's T20 World Cup boycott threat could spark prolonged chaos beyond one tournament. With future ICC events at stake, the former captain believes the controversy is only beginning.

Gavaskar trolls Pakistan's India boycott: Like their cricketers, a U-turn awaitsSunil Gavaskar took a swipe at Pakistan's India boycott call at the T20 World Cup, saying mounting pressure could force a U-turn, just as their cricketers have often reversed retirement decisions.

ICC warns Pakistan of long-term implications over boycotting T20 WC clash vs IndiaThe International Cricket Council (ICC) has reacted strongly against Pakistan's government's decision to boycott their match against India in the T20 World Cup 2026. ICC has warned the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) about large scale implications of their decision, saying that their stance is difficult to reconcile.

ICC must impose strict sanctions on Pakistan for boycotting India game: GavaskarSunil Gavaskar has urged the ICC to take strict action against Pakistan for boycotting India in the T20 World Cup 2026. The move could lead to severe penalties affecting Pakistan's cricketing future and its ICC tournament hosting rights.

India to fly to SL, do usual pre-match duties despite Pakistan boycott: SourcesT20 World Cup 2026: According to sources, the Indian team will travel to Sri Lanka, complete their scheduled pre-match preparations, and await the match referee's decision should Pakistan fail to take the field following the news of their boycott of the game against India.

Salman Agha reacts after Pakistan's decision to boycott T20 World Cup game vs IndiaPakistan skipper Salman Agha reacted to the government's decision to boycott their T20 World Cup match against India. The Government of Pakistan confirmed that the team would participate in the tournament but would not take the field against India.

Will ICC punish Pakistan for boycotting India at T20 World Cup?The International Cricket Council has reportedly not received any official or written communication from the Pakistan Cricket Board regarding its decision to boycott India in the ICC Men's T20 World Cup. Sources told India Today that the ICC would consider any action or sanctions only after the PCB formally communicates its position.

U-19 World Cup: India thrash Pakistan by 58 runs to seal semi-final berthUnder 19 World Cup, IND vs PAK: India qualified for the semi-finals of the Under-19 World Cup 2026 after beating Pakistan by 58 runs at Queens Sports Club in Bulawayo. Asked to chase a target of 253 runs, Pakistan got all out for 194 runs in 46.2 overs.

Carlos Alcaraz doffs hat to Novak Djokovic for silencing doubtersAustralian Open: Carlos Alcaraz heaped praise on Novak Djokovic for proving the naysayers wrong by qualifying for the final at Melbourne. Djokovic beat Jannik Sinner in the semis, but lost to Alcaraz in four sets in the final.

Novak Djokovic refuses to give up on 25th Grand Slam dream: I always believe I canNovak Djokovic is not ready to walk away from his pursuit of a record-extending 25th Grand Slam title, even after suffering his first-ever defeat in an Australian Open final on Sunday.

Carlos Alcaraz sounds alarm to his doubters after historic Australian Open winAustralian Open 2026: Carlos Alcaraz hit back at his critics after becoming the youngest man to complete the Career Grand Slam, defeating Novak Djokovic in four sets to win the Australian Open.

Pakistan to boycott India match at T20 World Cup, ICC warns of falloutPakistan will play the T20 World Cup but will not play their match against India, confirmed the country's government on Sunday, February 1. Pakistan were set to clash against India on February 15 in Colombo.

Pakistan warm up for T20 World Cup with historic T20I series clean sweep vs AustraliaPAK vs AUS, 3rd T20I: Salman Ali Agha's Pakistan hammered Australia by 111 runs in the third T20I to complete a 3-0 whitewash as a big boost before the T20 World Cup.

Karnataka, Andhra, Jharkhand, J&K through to quarterfinals with MumbaiKarnataka, Andhra, Jharkhand and Jammu & Kashmir sealed their places in the Ranji Trophy quarterfinals on a dramatic final day of group-stage action, joining already-qualified Mumbai in the knockout round.

Novak Djokovic's moving shoutout to Rafael Nadal steals spotlight after Aus Open finalNovak Djokovic paid an emotional tribute to Rafael Nadal during the Australian Open ceremony, honouring the 22-time Grand Slam champion who watched from the stands. Despite dominating the first set, Djokovic ultimately fell to Carlos Alcaraz, who completed a Career Grand Slam.

Carlos Alcaraz breaks 88-year record, rewrites history with Career Grand SlamCarlos Alcaraz ended an 88-year wait on Sunday night, completing a career Grand Slam with a four-set victory over Novak Djokovic in the Australian Open final. Aged 22 years and 272 days, the Spaniard became the youngest man in history to win all four major singles titles, surpassing the record set by Don Budge in 1938.

DC-W vs UPW, Live Score: Delhi qualify for Eliminator with 5-wicket victoryDC vs UPW, WPL 2026 Live Score: UP Warriorz have been knocked out of the tournament as they needed at least 157 runs to stay in the hunt. Delhi Capitals, on the other hand, have qualified for the Eliminator with a 5-wicket victory.

Djokovic leaves retirement call to the almighty after Australian Open final defeatAustralian Open: Novak Djokovic hinted at an uncertain future after his Australian Open final loss to Carlos Alcaraz, admitting he never expected to be back at a Grand Slam closing ceremony at this stage of his career.

India, Pakistan captains continue no handshake policy in Under-19 World Cup 2026India and Pakistan continued their no-handshake policy during their Super Six match in the Under-19 World Cup 2026. The two teams have not done handshakes since the Asia Cup 2025.

Alcaraz crowns Career Slam dream, keeps Djokovic's historic 25th on holdAustralian Open 2026: Carlos Alcaraz became the youngest man to complete the Career Grand Slam after defeating 10-time champion Novak Djokovic 2-6, 6-2, 6-3, 7-5 on Sunday at the Rod Laver Arena. The loss also prolonged Djokovic's wait for a record-extending 25th Grand Slam title.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
